intro: Paepalanthus silveirae, commonly known as the Silveira's burro's tail, is a succulent plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features dense clusters of fleshy, triangular leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers during the warmer months, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in collections of succulents.
